alert.note: Alert for Coastal Gulf (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued August 07 at 4:14AM EDT until August 07 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM EDT /1 PM CDT/ THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents expected. * WHERE...Gulf County Beaches. * WHEN...From 2 PM EDT /1 PM CDT/ this afternoon through this evening. * IMPACTS...Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Surf heights are forecast to be around 2 feet for state park and west facing beaches along the peninsula.
info.instruction: Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
